original: Frankman, Kurt Gustav, fil. lic., teol. kand., Göteborg, f. 27/2/07 i Lund. — Stud:ex. 27, fil. kand. 30, stud. f. prof. Erland Nordenskiöld v. Gbgs högsk. o. dr Walter Kaudern, fil. lic. 34, teol. kand. 41. Div. res. på kontinenten, t. Afr., Västind., Sydamer. 22-35. E. aman. v. Lunds univ. fo’lkm:arkiv 31-34, lärov:lär. fr. 42, e. o. .adj. v. die lalijm. iliärov. 47. Skr.: Kaisit-högar O’, foirngravar (Skån. Hemb. års-b. 32), Våra liv f. Mikado. Jap. patriotism (36), Med rödskinn på prärien (Indianetnogr. f. ungd. 35), Prästhistorier (und. pseud. K. G. Olofs-son 42), Sko’1’historier (samma pseud. 45), Läroverkspojkar (tiWs. m. Olle Helander 46), I högsta ringen (47).
translated: Frankman, Kurt Gustav, BA, Bachelor of Theology, from Gothenburg, born on February 27th, 1907 in Lund. He passed his studentexamen (high school exit exam) in 1927, obtained his bachelor's degree in 1930, and was a student in the department of professor Erland Nordenskiöld at Gothenburg's university. He also studied under Dr. Walter Kaudern and obtained a fil. lic. (a research degree) in 1934 and a bachelor's degree in theology in 1941. He traveled extensively in Africa, the West Indies, and South America between 1922 and 1935. He worked as an assistant at Lund University's folk archive from 1931 to 1934, was a schoolteacher beginning in 1942, and was an acting adjunct teacher at Die Laliöv High School in 1947. He wrote several works, including "Kaisit-högar O', forngravar (Skåne Hembygdårsbok 32)," "Our Lives for the Mikado: Japanese Patriotism (1936)," "Redskins on the Prairie (Indian Ethnography for Young People 1935)," "Pastor Stories (under the pseudonym K.G. Olsson 1942)," "Shoe Stories (same pseudonym 1945)," "High School Boys (with Olle Helander 1946)," and "In the Highest Circle (1947)."

hasWritten.name: Our Lives for the Mikado: Japanese Patriotism
